name: DVC
description: Version control for machine learning models, datasets, and pipelines, with Git integration.

name: Delta Lake
description: Storage layer for data lakes that brings ACID transactions and schema enforcement on big data.

name: lakeFS
description: Git-like repository for data lakes, enabling versioned, branching data and reproducible data pipelines.

name: Pachyderm
description: Data-centric pipeline platform with data versioning and lineage tracking on Kubernetes.

name: Quilt
description: Data hub for versioned data packages with S3 integration, enabling dataset collaboration and reuse.

name: Dolt
description: SQL database with Git-like version control. Supports forking, branching, merging of tabular data.

name: Marquez
description: Open source metadata service for collecting and visualizing data lineage in pipelines.

name: Great Expectations
description: Framework for creating and enforcing data quality checks and validation tests on pipelines.

name: Label Studio
description: Open source data labeling and annotation tool supporting images, text, audio, and video labeling.

name: Snorkel
description: A system for programmatically generating training labels using weak supervision techniques.

name: Feast
description: Open-source feature store for machine learning, enabling feature definition, ingestion, and serving.

name: Hopsworks
description: Feature store and end-to-end machine learning platform, with feature engineering and model serving capabilities.

name: Feathr
description: High performance feature store originally developed by LinkedIn, for defining and serving features at scale.

name: Tecton
description: Fully-managed enterprise feature platform to build, deploy, and monitor features for ML in production.

name: Airflow
description: Popular platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor data and ML workflows.

name: Luigi
description: Python module from Spotify that helps build complex pipelines of batch jobs with dependencies.

name: Prefect
description: Modern workflow orchestration system for data and ML pipelines, available open-source and as a cloud service.

name: Argo Workflows
description: Container-native workflow engine for orchestrating parallel jobs on Kubernetes, often used for ML pipelines.

name: Kubeflow
description: Kubernetes-based platform to develop, orchestrate, and deploy machine learning workflows at scale.

name: TensorFlow Extended (TFX)
description: End-to-end ML pipeline framework by Google, including components for data prep, training, and serving (TFX).

name: Flyte
description: Production-grade, Kubernetes-native workflow orchestrator for scalable machine learning and data pipelines.

name: Metaflow
description: Human-friendly Python library from Netflix to build and manage real-world data science workflows.

name: MLRun
description: Open source framework to build and monitor ML pipelines, functions and serverless jobs on Kubernetes (from Iguazio).

name: ZenML
description: Extensible MLOps framework to create reproducible ML pipelines, with integrations to various tools.

name: Dagster
description: Modern data orchestrator for ML, analytics, and ETL pipelines with a focus on data asset management.

name: Kedro
description: Framework implementing software engineering best practices for data and ML pipelines, by QuantumBlack.

name: Ploomber
description: Pipeline development framework that lets you build and deploy data science pipelines from Jupyter or any IDE.

name: MLflow
description: Platform for managing the ML lifecycle, including experiment tracking, model registry, and deployment.

name: Neptune.ai
description: Lightweight experiment tracking and model registry SaaS, with a focus on metadata and custom charts.

name: Weights & Biases
description: Popular platform for tracking and visualizing ML experiments, model artifacts, and hyperparameter optimization.

name: Comet ML
description: SaaS for experiment tracking, model management, and visualization with collaborative reporting features.

name: ClearML
description: Open source suite for experiment tracking, orchestration, and dataset management with a free hosted option.

name: Aim
description: Open source tool to record, search, and visualize hundreds of ML experiments with a streamlined UI.

name: Guild AI
description: Open source experiment tracking, pipeline automation, and hyperparameter tuning framework via simple command-line interface.

name: Polyaxon
description: Platform for reproducible and scalable machine learning on Kubernetes, covering experiments, pipelines, and deployment.

name: Optuna
description: Open source hyperparameter optimization framework with an intuitive API for automated search.

name: Hyperopt
description: Distributed asynchronous hyperparameter optimization library with support for various search algorithms.

name: Ray
description: Distributed computing framework that provides libraries for scalable hyperparameter tuning (Ray Tune), model serving (Ray Serve), and more.

name: Katib
description: Kubernetes-based system for hyperparameter tuning and neural architecture search, part of Kubeflow.

name: NNI (Neural Network Intelligence)
description: Microsoft's open source AutoML toolkit for hyperparameter optimization, neural architecture search, and feature engineering.

name: AutoGluon
description: AutoML toolkit by AWS for tabular, text, and image data that automates model training and tuning.

name: AutoKeras
description: AutoML library based on Keras, aimed to make deep learning accessible by automating model selection and tuning.

name: Auto-sklearn
description: Automated machine learning toolkit that extends scikit-learn with automatic model and hyperparameter selection.

name: Auto-PyTorch
description: Automatic architecture and hyperparameter search for PyTorch, focusing on tabular data.

name: TPOT
description: Tree-based Pipeline Optimization Tool that uses genetic programming to optimize ML pipelines over scikit-learn components.

name: FLAML
description: Fast and lightweight AutoML library from Microsoft that finds accurate models efficiently with low computational cost.

name: H2O.ai (H2O3)
description: Open source machine learning platform with distributed algorithms and AutoML (H2O AutoML) for tabular data.

name: Ludwig
description: Low-code declarative machine learning tool originally by Uber that allows training and deploying models without coding.

name: MindsDB
description: Automated machine learning integrated with databases, enabling ML model training and inference via SQL queries.

name: EvalML
description: Library for automated pipeline building, model selection, and evaluation with a focus on ease-of-use and extensibility.

name: TensorFlow Serving
description: Flexible, high-performance serving system for machine learning models, optimized for TensorFlow models in production.

name: TorchServe
description: Model serving framework for PyTorch that makes it easy to deploy trained PyTorch models at scale.

name: Triton Inference Server
description: Open-source inference serving software by NVIDIA that supports multiple ML frameworks and high-performance GPU serving.

name: KServe
description: Kubernetes Custom Resource (formerly KFServing) for deploying and serving machine learning models on Kubernetes.

name: Seldon Core
description: Open-source platform for deploying machine learning models at scale on Kubernetes with advanced orchestration and monitoring.

name: BentoML
description: Open-source framework for packaging and deploying ML models as scalable microservices, with a model store and runtime.

name: MLServer
description: Lightweight server for ML model inference, supporting multiple frameworks and designed to work with MLFlow and Kubernetes.

name: Gradio
description: Library for building easy-to-use web UIs for machine learning models, allowing quick model demos and deployments.

name: Streamlit
description: Open source Python library to create data apps and dashboards for ML models with minimal code.

name: Hugging Face Hub
description: Platform for sharing ML models and datasets, with an inference API and free model hosting for community models.

name: Arize AI
description: End-to-end ML observability platform for monitoring model performance, drift, and data quality in production.

name: Fiddler AI
description: Model monitoring and explainability platform to track performance, bias, and drift of AI models in production.

name: Evidently
description: Open source library providing interactive reports and dashboards to analyze data drift, model performance, and fairness.

name: Superwise
description: Enterprise model observability platform for monitoring predictive performance, data integrity, and drift with automated alerts.

name: WhyLabs (whylogs)
description: Open source library (whylogs) for logging ML data and statistics, with a monitoring platform (WhyLabs) for drift detection and alerts.

name: Aporia
description: ML model monitoring and observability solution that allows custom metrics, drift detection, and explainability insights.

name: NannyML
description: Open source library to estimate post-deployment model performance (without ground truth) and detect data drift.

name: Deepchecks
description: Open source tool for testing and validating machine learning models and data with a battery of built-in checks.

name: Starwhale
description: Open-source MLOps platform for dataset and model versioning, evaluation, and model collaboration (with LLM support).

name: Trubrics
description: Open source framework to collect feedback on model predictions and validate machine learning models with human-in-the-loop.

name: Netron
description: Visualizer for neural network models that supports numerous model formats (ONNX, Keras, TensorFlow, Caffe, etc.).

name: TensorBoard
description: Suite of visualization tools for TensorFlow and other frameworks to inspect and monitor metrics, graphs, and other training data.

name: IBM AI Fairness 360 (AIF360)
description: Comprehensive toolkit offering metrics and algorithms to detect and mitigate bias in datasets and machine learning models.

name: Fairlearn
description: Open source toolkit from Microsoft for assessing and improving the fairness of machine learning models.

name: Alibi
description: Open source library by Seldon for machine learning model inspection and interpretation (e.g., anchors, counterfactuals).

name: SHAP
description: Library implementing Shapley Additive Explanations to interpret predictions of any machine learning model.

name: LIME
description: Library for Local Interpretable Model-Agnostic Explanations, used to explain individual predictions of black-box models.

name: Captum
description: Model interpretability library for PyTorch providing state-of-the-art algorithms to explain models (feature attribution, etc).

name: Azure Machine Learning
description: Managed cloud platform by Microsoft for end-to-end ML lifecycle, including dataset management, training, deployment, and monitoring.

name: Amazon SageMaker
description: AWS's fully-managed service covering the entire machine learning workflow: data preparation, model training, tuning, deployment, and monitoring.

name: Google Cloud Vertex AI
description: Google Cloud's unified platform for ML development, including AutoML, custom training, model deployment, and data labeling services.

name: DataRobot
description: Enterprise AI platform providing automated machine learning, model deployment, and monitoring at scale for business users.

name: Dataiku
description: Collaborative data science platform that enables preparation, model development, and deployment in an end-to-end GUI environment.

name: Domino Data Lab
description: Enterprise platform for data science workbench, model deployment, and collaboration, unifying data science tools in one place.

name: MLReef
description: Open source MLOps platform for collaboration, versioning, and reuse of ML projects, from data exploration to model deployment.

name: Paperspace Gradient
description: Cloud-based MLOps platform offering notebooks, automated training, hyperparameter tuning, and deployment on a unified infrastructure.

name: Valohai
description: MLOps platform for automating ML pipelines with versioning and reproducibility, designed to take models from POC to production.

name: CNVRG.io
description: End-to-end machine learning platform to build, deploy, and manage models, with support for Kubernetes and scalable compute.

name: Lightning AI
description: Platform built around PyTorch Lightning for research to production, enabling distributed training, model deployment and an app marketplace.

name: Determined AI
description: Open source deep learning training platform that provides distributed training, hyperparameter tuning, and experiment management.

name: CML (Continuous Machine Learning)
description: Open-source library for implementing continuous integration & delivery (CI/CD) in ML projects using GitHub Actions or GitLab CI.

name: Papermill
description: Tool for parameterizing and executing Jupyter Notebooks, enabling notebooks to be used as reusable pipeline components.

name: Labelbox
description: Collaborative data labeling platform with support for image, text, video annotation, along with labeling automation and model-assisted labeling.

name: CVAT
description: Web-based tool for annotating video and images for computer vision, supporting bounding boxes, polygons, and interpolation for video.

name: OpenML
description: Open platform for sharing machine learning datasets, algorithms, and experiment results, enabling reproducible research and benchmarking.

name: Phoenix (Arize Phoenix)
description: Open-source toolkit (by Arize AI) for troubleshooting and fine-tuning ML models, including large language models, through interactive analysis.

name: Cronitor
description: Monitors any cron job or scheduled task to ensure they run on time.

name: Healthchecks.io
description: Simple and effective cron job monitoring service (free for small number of jobs).

name: Amundsen
description: Data discovery and metadata engine that improves productivity when interacting with data.

name: Apache Atlas
description: Open metadata management and governance framework to build a data catalog.

name: CKAN
description: Open-source data management system for powering data hubs and portals.

name: DataHub
description: Generalized metadata search and discovery tool originally developed at LinkedIn.

name: Magda
description: Federated, open-source data catalog for both big data and small data.

name: Metacat
description: Unified metadata exploration API service for datasets (Hive, RDS, Redshift, etc.).

name: OpenMetadata
description: Centralized platform to discover, collaborate on, and get your data right with rich metadata management.

name: Upgini
description: Open-source library that enriches training datasets with relevant features from public/community data sources.

name: Apache Zeppelin
description: Web-based notebook for interactive data analytics and collaborative documentation.

name: Bamboolib
description: Intuitive GUI for pandas DataFrames that allows data exploration and transformation without coding.

name: DataPrep
description: Low-code library to collect, clean, and visualize data in Python.

name: Google Colab
description: Hosted Jupyter notebook service with free GPU/TPU that requires no setup.

name: Jupyter Notebook
description: Web-based interactive computing notebook environment for Python and other languages.

name: JupyterLab
description: Next-generation user interface for Project Jupyter, supporting notebooks, code, and data.

name: Jupytext
description: Jupyter Notebooks as Markdown or script files, enabling bidirectional conversion.

name: Pandas Profiling
description: Generate HTML profiling reports from pandas DataFrame data.

name: Polynote
description: Polyglot notebook with first-class Scala support (mix Scala, Python, etc. in one notebook).

name: Arrikto
description: Enterprise storage and data management solution for hybrid Kubernetes environments (e.g., Kubeflow).

name: BlazingSQL
description: Lightweight, GPU-accelerated SQL engine for Python built on NVIDIA RAPIDS (for high-speed data analytics).

name: Dud
description: Lightweight CLI tool for versioning data alongside source code and building data pipelines.

name: Git LFS
description: Git extension for versioning large files (binary data) in a Git repository.

name: Hub
description: Dataset format and toolkit for creating, storing, and collaborating on AI datasets of any size (Activeloop Hub).

name: Intake
description: Lightweight tools for loading and sharing data in data science workflows via data catalog ingestion.

name: Milvus
description: Open-source vector database for embedding similarity search at scale (supports billions of vectors).

name: Pinecone
description: Managed vector similarity search service for high-performance vector embedding queries.

name: Qdrant
description: Open-source vector similarity search engine with filtering support for neural search use-cases.

name: Azkaban
description: Batch job scheduler (originally from LinkedIn) for running Hadoop jobs and other batch processes.

name: OpenRefine
description: Power tool for cleaning and transforming messy data (formerly Google Refine).

name: Hadoop
description: Framework for distributed processing of large data sets across clusters of computers.

name: Apache Spark
description: Unified analytics engine for large-scale distributed data processing and machine learning.

name: Cerberus
description: Lightweight, extensible schema and data validation library for Python.

name: Cleanlab
description: Library for data-centric AI, helping find and fix label issues and train models with noisy data.

name: JSON Schema
description: An open standard schema for validating and annotating JSON data structures.

name: TensorFlow Data Validation
description: Library (part of TFX) to explore and validate machine learning data (detect schema anomalies, drift, etc.).

name: Count
description: Notebook-based BI tool with SQL and drag-and-drop querying for data exploration and reporting.

name: Dash
description: Open-source framework for building analytical web applications in Python, R, or Julia.

name: Google Data Studio
description: Free cloud reporting and dashboarding tool for data visualization (rebranded as Looker Studio).

name: Facets
description: Open-source visualization tool for understanding and analyzing machine learning datasets.

name: Grafana
description: Popular open source platform for dashboards and interactive visualizations of metrics and logs.

name: Lux
description: Python library for automating data visualization and exploration with Pandas.

name: Metabase
description: Easy, fast, open source business intelligence platform for sharing data and analytics.

name: Redash
description: Open-source platform for querying data sources and visualizing results in dashboards.

name: SolidUI
description: AI-driven visualization prototyping and editing platform supporting 2D and 3D model visualizations via natural language.

name: Superset
description: Modern, enterprise-ready business intelligence web application (open source by Apache).

name: Tableau
description: Powerful and widely used business intelligence and data visualization tool with rich interactive dashboards.

name: Frouros
description: Open-source Python library for drift detection in machine learning systems.

name: TorchDrift
description: Lightweight library for detecting data and concept drift in PyTorch models.

name: Feature Engine
description: Python feature engineering library with scikit-learn-like functionality for preprocessing.

name: Featuretools
description: Python library for automated feature engineering (handles relational and time series data).

name: TSFresh
description: Python library for automated feature extraction from time series datasets.

name: Butterfree
description: Tool for building feature stores: transform raw data into production-ready features.

name: ByteHub
description: Easy-to-use feature store optimized for time-series data.

name: Featureform
description: Open-source virtual feature store that turns existing infrastructure into a feature store.

name: Advisor
description: Open-source implementation of Google Vizier for scalable hyperparameter tuning.

name: Hyperas
description: Very simple wrapper library for convenient hyperparameter optimization with Keras (uses Hyperopt).

name: Keras Tuner
description: Easy-to-use, scalable hyperparameter optimization framework for Keras/TensorFlow.

name: Scikit-Optimize
description: Simple and efficient library for black-box optimization over parameter spaces (Bayesian optimization).

name: Talos
description: Hyperparameter optimization for TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch with a concise API.

name: Tune
description: Python library (part of Ray) for scalable experiment execution and hyperparameter tuning.

name: Knowledge Repo
description: Open-source knowledge sharing platform by Airbnb that turns notebooks and markdown documents into a shared repository.

name: Kyso
description: Central hub for data insights where teams can publish reports, notebooks, and data analyses collaboratively.

name: aiWARE
description: Enterprise platform by Veritone for evaluating, deploying, integrating, scaling, and monitoring ML models (AI workflow platform).

name: Bodywork
description: Open-source framework to deploy Python ML projects to Kubernetes with minimal fuss.

name: CNVRG
description: End-to-end machine learning platform to build and deploy models at scale (acquired by Intel).

name: Edge Impulse
description: Platform for developing and deploying TinyML models on edge devices, with an emphasis on sensor data and embedded AI.

name: envd
description: Open-source machine learning development environment that simplifies environment setup for data science and ML engineering teams.

name: FedML
description: Open platform for federated learning anywhere at any scale, enabling distributed training across edge and cloud.

name: Gradient
description: Paperspace Gradient – a multi-cloud CI/CD and MLOps platform for machine learning teams (managed notebooks, training, deployment).

name: Katonic
description: Cloud-native MLOps platform to automate the ML lifecycle, from data preparation to model deployment and monitoring.

name: Knime
description: Open-source data science platform with an intuitive GUI for creating end-to-end data science workflows.

name: LynxKite
description: Complete graph data science platform for very large graphs, enabling graph analytics and Graph AI workflows.

name: ML Workspace
description: All-in-one web-based IDE for machine learning and data science, preloaded with common ML tools (self-hosted container).

name: Neu.ro
description: Cloud platform that integrates open-source and proprietary tools into a unified MLOps system for teams.

name: Omnimizer
description: Platform bridging the gap between ML models and edge hardware, simplifying and accelerating model optimization for edge deployment.

name: SAS Viya
description: Cloud-native analytics and AI platform by SAS supporting the entire analytics life cycle with scalable processing.

name: Sematic
description: Open-source end-to-end pipeline development framework to go from prototyping on a laptop to production in the cloud with minimal effort.

name: SigOpt
description: Optimization platform (acquired by Intel) for tracking runs, visualizing training, and scaling hyperparameter tuning experiments.

name: TrueFoundry
description: Cloud-native MLOps platform on Kubernetes to simplify model training and serving through automation and CI/CD principles.

name: AIF360
description: Comprehensive toolkit by IBM for fairness metrics and bias mitigation algorithms in datasets and models.

name: Opacus
description: Library for training PyTorch models with differential privacy (by Meta AI).

name: TensorFlow Privacy
description: Library for training TensorFlow models with privacy-preserving techniques (differential privacy).

name: ELI5
description: Python package to debug and explain machine learning classifiers and predictions (sklearn, etc.).

name: InterpretML
description: Microsoft's toolkit to help explain models and enable responsible machine learning (includes glassbox and blackbox explainers).

name: Lucid
description: A collection of infrastructure and tools for research in neural network interpretability (mainly for TensorFlow models).

name: SAGE
description: Library for computing global feature importance using the Shapley Additive Global importancE (SAGE) method.

name: Aeromancy
description: Framework for creating reproducible AI/ML workflows with Weights & Biases (automates W&B pipeline setups).

name: Cascade
description: Library of ML engineering tools for rapid prototyping and experiment management.

name: Keepsake
description: Version control system for machine learning, with support for dataset and model versioning (S3/Google Cloud Storage).

name: Losswise
description: Simple tool to track and visualize machine learning training progress via an intuitive API and dashboard.

name: ModelDB
description: Open source model metadata and experiment management system (early predecessor to Verta AI platform).

name: Sacred
description: Tool to help configure, organize, log, and reproduce experiments easily.

name: Banana
description: Serverless GPU hosting for ML inference – deploy model code and get an API endpoint with one line of code.

name: Beam
description: Platform for developing on serverless GPUs, deploying high-performance ML APIs, and rapid prototyping of models.

name: BudgetML
description: CLI tool to deploy a ML inference service on a budget (leverages cheap cloud instances) in under 10 lines of code.

name: Cog
description: Open-source tool to package machine learning models as standard, production-ready Docker containers.

name: Geniusrise
description: Modular MLOps framework for hosting inference APIs, running bulk inference, and fine-tuning text, vision, audio, and multi-modal models.

name: Hydrosphere
description: Open-source platform (Hydrosphere Serving) for deploying, versioning, and monitoring ML models in production (with Kubernetes).

name: KFServing (KServe)
description: Kubernetes Custom Resource Definition (CRD) for serving ML models on Kubernetes, supporting multiple frameworks (now known as KServe).

name: LocalAI
description: Open-source drop-in replacement REST API that's compatible with OpenAI API specs for local inference of LLMs.

name: Merlin
description: Open-source platform (by Gojek) for deploying and serving machine learning models, part of the FEAST ecosystem.

name: MLEM
description: Tool by Iterative to version and deploy ML models following GitOps principles (integrates with DVC).

name: Opyrator
description: Open-source toolkit that turns ML code into production-ready microservices with a web API and optional GUI.

name: Quix
description: Serverless platform for real-time data stream processing with ML models (offers open-source streaming library and managed cloud service).

name: Rune
description: Open-source tool to containerize and deploy edge ML pipelines as lightweight portable containers (using WebAssembly).

name: Vespa
description: Open-source engine for large-scale data serving, combining search with integrated ML inference over big data in real-time.

name: Wallaroo.AI
description: Enterprise platform for deploying, serving, and optimizing ML models in cloud and edge environments with ultra-low latency.

name: Accelerate
description: Lightweight library by Hugging Face to easily train and run PyTorch models on multiple GPUs/TPUs with mixed precision.

name: Dask
description: Parallel computing library enabling performance at scale for Python analytics workflows (parallel arrays, dataframes, etc.).

name: DeepSpeed
description: Optimization library by Microsoft that makes distributed deep learning training easy, efficient, and effective (zero redundancy optimizer, etc.).

name: Fiber
description: Python distributed computing library (from Uber) for modern computer clusters, making it simple to scale ML workloads.

name: Horovod
description: Distributed deep learning training framework for TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet (uses ring-allreduce).

name: Modin
description: Drop-in replacement for pandas to speed up DataFrame computations by distributing across cores or clusters.

name: Nebullvm
description: Easy-to-use library to automatically optimize AI model inference (compiling to TensorRT, ONNX, etc. for speed-ups).

name: Nos
description: Open-source framework to run AI workloads on Kubernetes in an optimized way (scheduling and resource optimization).

name: Petastorm
description: Enables single-machine or distributed training and evaluation of deep learning models directly from data in Parquet format.

name: Rapids
description: Suite of open-source libraries from NVIDIA for end-to-end GPU-accelerated data science (data prep, model training, etc. all on GPUs).

name: Singa
description: Apache Singa – distributed deep learning library with flexible architecture for scalable training.

name: ChassisML
description: CLI tool that turns ML models into portable, containerized microservices that can run anywhere (aims to simplify model deployment).

name: Hermione
description: Helps data scientists set up more organized code in a quicker and simpler way (project scaffolding and structuring).

name: Hydra
description: Framework for elegantly configuring complex applications via a powerful config system (composition of configurations).

name: Koalas
description: Pandas API on Apache Spark that lets data scientists be more productive with big data using familiar pandas syntax.

name: MLNotify
description: Tiny open-source library to get desktop notifications when long-running machine learning trainings or experiments complete.

name: PyCaret
description: Open-source, low-code machine learning library in Python that automates machine learning workflows.

name: Sagify
description: CLI tool to train and deploy ML/DL models on AWS SageMaker easily (containerizes code and handles SageMaker interactions).

name: Soopervisor
description: Tool to export data science pipelines to various orchestrators (Kubernetes via Argo, Airflow, AWS Batch, etc.) with minimal changes.

name: Soorgeon
description: Utility to convert Jupyter notebooks into maintainable pipelines by splitting into modular tasks.

name: TrainGenerator
description: Web application to generate template code for machine learning projects to jump-start model training pipelines.

name: Turi Create
description: Open-source toolkit by Apple that simplifies the development of custom machine learning models (especially for iOS apps) without extensive coding.

name: Fiddler
description: Enterprise platform to monitor, explain, and analyze AI models in production (focus on model performance & bias).

name: Manifold
description: Model-agnostic visual debugging tool from Uber for ML models, to identify issues via partial dependence and performance analysis.

name: Opik
description: Open-source platform (by Comet) to debug, evaluate, and monitor LLM applications with tracing and evaluation tools.

name: Phoenix
description: Open-source notebook-based ML observability tool by Arize for troubleshooting and fine-tuning LLM, CV, and tabular models.

name: Radicalbit
description: Open-source platform (Nexus) for monitoring AI models in production, with real-time data and model performance tracking.

name: WhyLogs
description: Open-source standard for data logging – enables data and ML monitoring by logging statistics from production data in a lightweight way.

name: Yellowbrick
description: Suite of visual diagnostic tools to facilitate machine learning model selection and evaluation (built on scikit-learn).

name: Automate Studio
description: Visual drag-and-drop tool for building and deploying AI-powered workflows (from Veritone).

name: Couler
description: Unified interface for constructing and managing workflows on different workflow engines (e.g., Argo, K8s, Airflow).

name: dstack
description: Open-core tool to automate data and training workflows, enabling easy snapshotting of experiments and remote execution.

name: Hamilton
description: Scalable micro-framework for defining dataflows with a function-centric approach, making DAG creation intuitive.

name: Kale
description: Kubeflow extension that simplifies converting Jupyter notebooks to Kubeflow Pipelines workflows.

name: Orchest
description: Open-source visual pipeline editor and workflow orchestrator with an easy-to-use UI running on Kubernetes.

name: VDP
description: Versatile Data Pipeline – open-source tool to seamlessly integrate AI into the modern data stack for unstructured data processing.

name: Wordware
description: Web-hosted IDE where non-technical domain experts can build task-specific AI agents via a no-code interface.

name: Determined
description: Open source deep learning training platform that provides distributed training, hyperparameter tuning, and experiment management.

name: DVC Studio
description: Visual interface for DVC, the Data Version Control system, enabling easy versioning and collaboration on datasets and models.

name: Ray Tune
description: Python library (part of Ray) for scalable experiment execution and hyperparameter tuning.

name: Weights & Biases Sweeps
description: Sweep management and hyperparameter tuning tool by Weights & Biases, supporting various search algorithms and frameworks.
